vulnerability_location.description: Unchecked multiplication of user-supplied `price` with `minGas` and `cancellationGas` when setting `MIN_FEE` and `CANCELLATION_FEE` can overflow in pre-0.8.0 Solidity
Multiple low-level calls (send and call) in deliver() are performed without checking their return values, leading to potential silent failures.
Low-level external calls to msg.sender.call.value() wrapped with externalCallFlag may fail and throw, leaving externalCallFlag permanently true and blocking future calls, causing a denial of service.
Functions taking an `address` parameter (newAddr in upgrade, callbackAddr in request) do not validate `msg.data.length`, allowing a short-address attack.
Floating pragma version (‘pragma solidity ^0.4.9;’) allows compilation with future 0.4.x compiler versions, risking inconsistent behavior or compiler-introduced bugs
